main_definition: Statistics is a branch of mathematics that deals with the collection, analysis, interpretation, presentation, and organization of data in order to understand trends and patterns.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The numerical data collected from observations or experiments
meanings_and_examples.example: In a survey about favorite ice cream flavors, the statistics would include numbers representing how many people chose each option.

meanings_and_examples.definition: The science of organizing, summarizing and analyzing numerical data to make it more understandable
meanings_and_examples.example: A company uses statistical methods to analyze sales trends over the past year to predict future performance.

meanings_and_examples.definition: Statistical results or findings reported from a research study or analysis
meanings_and_examples.example: The statistics of a clinical trial indicate that a new drug is effective in treating a disease with minimal side effects.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A set of rules, principles and methods used to gather data, analyze it and present the results
meanings_and_examples.example: When conducting an opinion poll, statisticians follow a specific set of guidelines (statistics) to ensure the accuracy of their findings.

meanings_and_examples.definition: A numerical measure that summarizes or describes aspects of a data set
meanings_and_examples.example: The mean (average), median and mode are all types of statistics used to describe a dataset's central tendency.
